thread.title: CN Rail's profit more than doubles on tax gain

title: CN Rail's profit more than doubles on tax gain
text:
January 23, 2018 / 9:24 PM / in a few seconds CN Rail's profit more than doubles on tax gain Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
(Reuters) - Canadian National Railway Co ( CNR.TO ) said on Tuesday that its fourth-quarter profit more than doubled on Tuesday, helped by an income tax gain due to the new U.S. tax code. 
Canada’s largest railroad’s net income surged to C$2.61 billion ($2.10 billion), or $C3.48 per share, from C$1.02 billion, or C$1.32 per share, a year earlier. 
The company recorded an income tax gain of C$1.76 billion for the latest period. 
Montreal-based CN’s total revenue rose to C$3.29 billion in the three months ended Dec. 31, from C$3.22 billion a year earlier. ($1 = C$1.24)
